availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, brickmason. Pennsylvania native. Married to Bathia Stricker. Father of William Stricker, Adalade Stricker, Charles Stricker, Edward Stricker, Sophia Stricker, Alice Stricker, and M. D. Stricker. Brickmason in Campbell County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 31A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 442B.
"Charles Stricker (1814-1877), Find A Grave, Memorial #89906907, accessed December 17, 2021, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89906907/charles-stricker.
